hints.content:
We can multiply to find the total number of eggs in all $15$ cartons.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/652c6baffbc1bc30f183bfd0395be52f92f2f2d9)

$\maroonD{12} \times 15 = \purpleD{180}$

We can add to find the total number of eggs, including the $\greenE{7}$ that were left over.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/72869653e54567601155893774b71d9a7059178c)

$\purpleD{180} +\greenE{7} = \redE{187}$

question.content:
After collecting eggs from his chickens, Dale puts the eggs into cartons to sell. Dale fills $15$ cartons and has $7$ eggs left over. Each carton holds $12$ eggs.

**How many eggs did Dale collect?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] eggs
